title: PFL 2019, Playoffs 3 predictions: Which four big men will advance to finals?
text:
The 2019 PFL playoffs conclude Thursday, with the light heavyweight and heavyweight brackets set to fight until a final is determined.

At light heavyweight, No. 1 seed Emiliano Sordi takes on Sigi Pesaleli, with the winner set to face the winner of Bozigit Ataev vs. Viktor Nemkov. On the other side of the bracket, No. 3 Vinny Magalhaes aims to return to the final, beginning with a fight against Rashid Yusupov. The winner will meet either No. 2 Maxim Grishin or Jordan Johnson.

At heavyweight, top seed Denis Goltsov takes on Satoshi Ishii. The winner will move on to fight the winner of Kelvin Tiller vs. Ali Isaev. And on the bottom half of the bracket, No. 3 Alex Nicholson fights Francimar Barroso. Either Muhammed DeReese or Jared Rosholt gets the winner.

Here’s a look at each bracket.

Light heavyweight

Heavyweight

PFL 2019, Playoffs 3 takes place at Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, and the card streams on ESPN+ and airs on ESPN2. You can check out the MMA Junkie staff’s predictions below:
